abstract: A new report shows that only one in four students in New York City is ready for college after four years of high school.
snippet: A new report shows that only one in four students in New York City is ready for college after four years of high school.
lead_paragraph: In today's Times, Fernanda Santos reports on new information released by the Bloomberg administration which concludes that only a quarter of New York City students are ready for college after four years of high school, and only half of them enroll in a form of higher education. The city, looking to strengthen both college readiness and enrollment numbers, will begin grading high schools based on these statistics next year.

headline.main: College Readiness Lacking in New York City, Report Shows
